results.title: Respiratory tract infection in children's wards
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Prevention of Cross Infection”.
Illustrates how cross infection by contact, droplet and dust borne methods may be prevented by isolation, barrier nursing and other methods. Written and directed by Margaret Thomson.

results.title: Respiratory and cardiac arrest
results.brief_description: Deals in detail with methods of resuscitation after heart failure during anaesthesia. It is treated in three parts: apparatus, respiratory obstruction, and cardiac arrest.

results.title: Respiration in man
results.brief_description: Living tissue and various instruments, techniques and experiments are used to illustrate the structure of the lungs. Movements of alveoli and blood in the vessels, gas concentration relationship, transport of 02 and C02, aortic and carotid bodies, and the function of carotid bodies are also shown. No other credits available.

results.title: Respecting differences (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Panorama Productions and New South Wales Government
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties that migrant children have in adjusting to Australian schools and culture, especially non-English speaking children. Recently the New South Wales Government has given funds to support the teaching of ethnic languages in many state schools which helps facilitate adjustment to Australian life.

results.title: Respect for property
results.brief_description: A gang of boys break into a rival group’s club house and destroy much of the contents. Instead of seeking revenge, the boys who suffered the damage seek the help of a local policeman who explains to them the meaning of private and public property. They relate their own loss to the damage they have done on school property and realise that public property is owned by everyone and not just one individual.

results.title: Resources in its crust
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Earth”.
The major useful organic and mineral substances found in the earth’s crust. Classifies the resources as the metallic minerals, the non-metallic minerals, and the mineral fuels. How some of them are extracted and processed. Steps necessary to conserve irreplaceable resources.

results.title: Reseeding for better grass
results.brief_description: A film for farmers, explaining how to turn coarse pasture lands into good grazing by ploughing up and re-seeding the land without either a cereal nurse crop or first putting it through a rotation.
